author: geekship
title: SOIL: E-Commerce
description: Il est difficile de se lancer dans le commerce des crypto-monnaies :)

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal lacks minimum fundamentals and does not have a lot of necessary information. It slightly touches what are the objectives but never goes into much detail. It does not describe any characteristics of the plug-in that was supposed to be the main topic of the challenge. Nor it articulates how this solution of creating a new token BIT and a platform called SOIL adds value to the Cardano ecosystem. Besides that, there is no discussion whatsoever about scalability. No key metrics were included in the proposal, this way it is not even possible to assess if they are aligned with the goals.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal is very unlikely to succeed. The author did not give much thought or dedication to develop a reasonable plan. Some evidence of necessary skills and experience were given by the LinkedIn link but still more could have been described about how this relates to the proposal. The budget is extremely low and there is no rationale behind it. It is not broken down into identifiable items. No timetable or roadmap is discussed and there are no milestones to analyze if the plan is sensible and what is being done nor how. All in all, it is a very lazy proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of this proposal is poor. No information is given on how it will be possible to track progress. No time horizon or milestones are discussed and no KPIs were defined. The impression is that there is no clear understanding of the targeted problem. Also, there is no clear description of the targeted solution. Some KPIs like ratio of successful transactions over total transactions to track if the solution is delivering what was promised would be desired. Additionally, KPIs regarding the scalability of the solution would interesting as this is a central aspect of the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The impact of selecting this proposal will be low as the author has indicated that he didn't have time to provide more details on this proposal. In fact, the proposer also said that his intention was to reach out to others interested in this domain and that his priority lays elsewhere. In the comments, he also indicated that he was trying to remove it - so it somehow passed into the assessment stage, without realistic prospects of implementation.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal does not include a detailed timeline, metrics or KPIs, nor does it have milestones. It has a placeholder budget of $42 and the proposer has indicated that he wished to retire the proposal. He indicated that COTI looks great and so it would be good if he submitted a revised proposal if this challenge is repeated. Hence the low score. Although there is room for initiatives of this type if they are well developed.
f6_assessments.q2: Alas without a detailed implementation plan and supporting information, it is impossible to verify whether this placeholder proposal will be implemented. Funding it would really represent a waste of money, despite the low sum that is involved. This is not a proposal that voters should be concerned with and can skip reading it (unless they have time on their hands!).

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has not provided any substantial information that addresses the challenge. The proposal is incomplete.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has not provided any link to team members, which i think does not make the proposal complete for review. The budget value is also insignificant to execute a project in this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer, has not provided any roadmap, metrics, KPI's, etc to help assessors make the right review. This proposal therefore does not contain the detailed information to aid in the auditing and measurement of success.

f6_assessments.q0: Not even sure if this idea belongs this challenge, because this does not have anywhere AdaPay integration in place. Additionally proposer himself mentions that he is focussing on other proposal for this round. I will suggest him to therefore take out the proposal from funding round if he thinks he has not given his best to take out this proposal. Incomplete proposals must be taken out so that they do not add unnecessary clutter with good proposals in any funding round. Good luck for next time
f6_assessments.q1: The idea seems to be good, but proposer himself mentions that he did not have enough time to do this proposal in best way possible, My suggestion therefore is to keep it for next fund and come back with much detailed plan. I am sure this will have good chances to get funded.
f6_assessments.q2: The idea seems to be good, but proposer himself mentions that he did not have enough time to do this proposal in best way possible, My suggestion therefore is to keep it for next fund and come back with much detailed plan. I am sure this will have good chances to get funded.

f6_assessments.q0: I fail to see how this correlates with the challenge? This proposal would've been a better fit in DApps & Integrations or even better mini/low budget DApps & Integrations. By creating a token and e-commerce platform you are not really integrating ADA Pay into the e-commerce platforms.
f6_assessments.q1: I like the idea and this could be of use to the ecosystem but we are lacking information in the proposal. You explain the big picture but are not including a roadmap. What steps do you need to take to make sure this proposal will be successful? Do you need extra team members to complete this project? The requested funds are also very low considering the scope of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: We don't get a sufficient amount of information to assess the progress of this proposal. By providing a roadmap we get to follow the project and have a guideline on where the project stands in development. Also think about what metrics/KPI you want, how many users/applications to do see ahead in the project. How do you plan to make your project/platform stand out above the rest?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal poses an open source prototyping problem for a simple e-commerce website that is connected to the SOIL platform by default. The problem is not very clear The proponent seems to have written a lot of suggestions in different challenges, however, with this proposal, I do not find it suitable for the challenge, as well as you need to be more clear the problem if you want to get funding
f6_assessments.q1:
While certain profile links were easily accessible to us, no other details were provided in the recommendation, making it impossible for us to assess experience and ability to make the recommendation. his. . The proposal does not specify what skills their team has, how large their team is, and whether they have had previous work in the field.
"I'm sorry I don't have time to elaborate on this proposal. I'm mainly submitting it to reach out to others interested in the field" as the proponent mentioned. I disagree that the information here is sufficient to test the process and success of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Since this is just an idea, not a complete plan, the budget is $42 for representation
The major weakness of this Proposal is that no precise planning or structure of the promised patterns is explained. There are no routes, no groups, no key events, and no action steps given in this proposal making it impossible to test. There is no KPI/Metric to determine the success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about creating an open-source template for a simple E-commerce website, that is connected to the SOIL platform by default. The problem statement is very abstract. The proposer has failed for showing what he wants to solve. In the "Big Picture", the problem is not clearly defined, instead of that , a token mechanism [creating, burning,...] is provided. The proposed solution is not clearly described [without any specific roadmap/timeline and KPIs, budget breakdown, ...]. As a result, there is no proof of addressing this challenge or showing the potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: Profile of the proposer is very briefly described, but understandable, shows suitable skill, and experiences for implementation, with an external link [LinkedIn]for verifying. Therefore, the profile convinces me in some certain aspects of feasibility. However, the plan was not well-prepared, without the budget breakdown, specific roadmap, KPIs, and risk management. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2: For better understanding, (1) Roadmap (with KPIs), (2) Budget distribution, (3) Risk management should be added. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal offers to develop an open source template for a E-commerce website. The problem statement is clear, but the proposal does not really articulate with the challenge which is to promote ADA-Pay. The proposal lack details on the solution, so it is difficult to evaluate how much it will add value to Cardano's ecosystem.
I disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: No timeline is defined, and challenges are very broadly explained. The proposer is identified by his LinkedIN profile and does have a relevant experience in software development. However, as the description solution is not elaborated in the proposal, I consider that it is at the ideation concept stage. I suggest the proposer to resubmit in a coming Catalyst round with a more elaborated description of the solution. At this stage, I disagree that this proposal is likely to be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal is more a concept idea, which explains why no precise metrics are listed to monitor its development. 
Only 42$ are requested, so I understand that the proposer does not really need this money to go further with the project. Next time, I recommend the proposer to withdraw a proposal if he hasn't have enough time to elaborate it.
Based on the Catalyst description, I consider that it would be impossible for the community to monitor the project development.

f6_assessments.q0: If I understand this proposal, the idea is about building a dapps with tokenomics and integration of simple website payment plug in integration. The proposal has not really stated in clear terms what it intends to achieve and the provided solution in my opinion does not address goals and challenges of the campaign.
f6_assessments.q1: The project's team has sufficient skill and experience to deliver on this proposal however there is no information on its budget and timeline/ roadmap to achieve a successful implementation. The proposal has to rework this project for future funding cycle.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal did not provide any information on KPIs or metric on how to assess this project if funded

solution: Créez un modèle open source pour un simple site de commerce électronique, qui est connecté par défaut à la plateforme SOIL.
experience:
Développeur de logiciels depuis plus de 10 ans, spécialisé dans le front-end depuis 5 ans.
